page.title: 05TRAIL FOR THE DISABLED
page.content: At the Whitestone picnic site and Cleddon Trail the Forestry Commission have created a special trail for the Blind and Partially-sighted.The entrance to the trail has a special gateway to allow wheelchairs easy acc- ess. The trail is created in a woodland of trees of varying types and ages.The area is tranquil and gives a splendid impression of the sites and sounds of a woodland.There are twelve trees along the trail each with a plaque carved with large letters giving information about their age, height and diameter. The oldest tree is a 95 year old Beech. The youngest is a 31 year old Grand Fir.Visitors can use their hands to read the notices and feel the bark of the trees.There is a handrail along the length of the trail.
